Class BinarySearchTree

  • java.lang.Object
    • BinarySearchTree

  • public class BinarySearchTree
extends java.lang.Object
    BinarySearchTree class is the main class of our concurrent Binary Search Tree. It provides three main methods: find(key), insert(key), delete(key). This implementation is non-blocking: starting from any configuration of any infinite asynchronous execution, with any number of crash failures, some operation always completes. There are also two possibilities to print the tree: 1) OCaml syntax; 2) Dot format;

    • Method Detail

      • search

        public SearchResult search(int key)
        Used by Insert, Delete and Find to traverse the BST searching (if it exists) the key.
        Parameters:
        key - Key to search
        Returns:
        SearchResult Structure containing the leaf, and other informations about the parent and grandparent of it

      • find

        public Leaf find(int key)
        Used to find the key.
        Parameters:
        key - Key to search
        Returns:
        The corresponding leaf if the key is in the tree, null otherwise

      • insert

        public boolean insert(int key)
        Used to insert the key. First of all it checks if the key already exists (duplicated keys are not admitted in the search tree), then it checks if there are other pending operations on the same nodes that he needs to operate on, in this case it tries to complete them, otherwise it builds a new structure with the key. After that it tries to change the state of its parent to "IFLAG", if this fails it helps the operation that has flagged or marked the parent, if any, and begins a new attempt. If the "IFLAG" succeeds, the rest of the insertion is done by HelpInsert.
        Parameters:
        key - Key to insert
        Returns:
        true if it succeeds, false otherwise

      • helpInsert

        public void helpInsert(IInfo op)
        Used by the insert function in order to complete the insertion of a key. It attempts to change the appropriate child pointer of the parent and it resets to "CLEAN" its update field.
        Parameters:
        op - IInfo record that carries on the necessary information for the completion of the insert

      • help

        public void help(Update u)
        General-purpose helping routine. This method checks the state field of the Update and calls the corresponding function in order to help and possibly finish the pending operation
        Parameters:
        u - Contains the state and the info record of the pending operation

      • casChild

        public void casChild(Internal parent,
                     Node old,
                     Node new_node)
        Atomically swap the pointer of the parent from the old node to the new one. Furthermore, it determines whether to change the left or right child of the parent, depending on the key values.
        Parameters:
        parent - Parent node
        old - Old node
        new_node - New node

      • delete

        public boolean delete(int key)
        Used to delete a key. It first calls the search method to find the leaf to be deleted (and its parent and grandparent). If it fails to find the key returns False. If it finds that some other operation has already flagged or marked the parent or grandparent, it helps that operation complete and then begins over with a new attempt. Otherwise, it creates a new DInfo record containing the necessary information and attempts to set the flag of the grandparent to "DFLAG". If this fails, it helps the operation that has flagged or marked the grandparent, if any, and then begins a new attempt. If the "DFLAG" is successful, the remainder of the deletion is carried out by HelpDelete. However, it is possible that the attempted deletion will fail to complete even after the grandparent is flagged (if some other operation has changed the parentâ€™s state and info fields before it can be marked), so HelpDelete returns a boolean value that describes whether the deletion was successfully completed. If it is successful, it returns True; otherwise, it tries again.
        Parameters:
        key - Key to delete
        Returns:
        true if it succeeds, false otherwise

      • helpDelete

        public boolean helpDelete(DInfo op)
        Used by the delete function in order to proceed with the deletion of a key. First it attempts to mark the parent of the leaf to be deleted, if it is successful, the remainder of the deletion is carried out by HelpMarked, otherwise it helps the operation that flagged the parent node and performs a backtrack: it removes the flag from the grandparent.
        Parameters:
        op - DInfo record that carries on the necessary information for the completion of the delete
        Returns:
        true if it marks the parent correctly and the operation can go on, false otherwise

      • helpMarked

        public void helpMarked(DInfo op)
        Used by the helpDelete in order to complete the deletion of a key. It changes the appropriate child pointer of the grandparent and it resets to "CLEAN" its update field.
        Parameters:
        op - DInfo record that carries on the necessary information for the completion of the delete

      • printTree

        public void printTree()
        Print the current tree in OCaml syntax

      • createDotGraph

        public void createDotGraph()
        Print the current tree in dot (graph description language). It saves the result in the external file tree.dot.

      • toDot

        public void toDot(Node i,
                  java.io.PrintWriter out)
        Used by createDotGraph: recursively print the left and right child of the node.
        Parameters:
        i - Current node
        out - File in which the function has to write.
